div.div: Ἑλένη : Helen, the wife of Menelāus, daughter of Zeus and Leda, Il. 3.199, 426, and sister of Castor and Pollux, Il. 3.238. Often w. the epithet Ἀργείη, Il. 2.161, Od. 4.184; Il. 3.91, 121, Ω 761, Od. 4.12, 219, 279. Helen returned to her home in Sparta after the war, and in the Odyssey is seen living happily with Menelāus, δ, ο.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
